noun.description: The action or process of removing or getting rid of something or of something's dispersing.
examples: cleaning of the machine should include clearance of blockages
there will be sunny intervals after clearance of any early mist

noun.description: Official authorization for something to proceed or take place.
examples: getting diplomatic clearance to fly into or over a country is not always easy

noun.description: Clear space allowed for a thing to move past or under another.
examples: always give cyclists plenty of clearance
